role_in_edaitutor: Deep conceptual and pathophysiology-based reference for emergency medicine, used for advanced explanations and fellowship-level reasoning.

chapters.chapter_title: Foundations of Emergency Medicine and Resuscitation
chapters.summary: Describes the conceptual foundations of emergency medicine, with emphasis on pathophysiology-driven resuscitation and systems-level perspectives.
Provides an in-depth, physiology-based discussion of shock and critical illness, guiding nuanced ED resuscitation strategies.
Explores advanced concepts in cardiovascular emergencies, integrating pathophysiology with ED diagnosis and acute management.
Discusses respiratory pathophysiology and its implications for ED management of acute dyspnoea and thoracic emergencies.
Provides high-level coverage of neurological emergencies, including cerebrovascular disease, seizures, and neurocritical care concepts.
Analyses abdominal and gastrointestinal emergencies from a pathophysiologic and diagnostic reasoning perspective.

chapters.chapter_title: Infectious Disease and the Immunocompromised Host
chapters.summary: Focuses on serious infections and the unique considerations of the immunocompromised patient in the ED.
Provides a conceptual framework for trauma care, integrating physiology, systems of care, and ED priorities.
Explores the biology and clinical presentation of musculoskeletal and orthopaedic conditions seen in the ED.
Describes the underlying principles of toxicology and environmental injury, informing rational ED management.
Addresses emergencies related to pregnancy, gynaecological pathology, and genitourinary presentations in the ED.
Covers fundamental concepts and disease patterns in paediatric emergency medicine, aligned with EM pathophysiology.
Addresses ED systems, ethics, prehospital care interactions, and quality frameworks for emergency medicine practice.
